Package ninja.jira.skeletonkey.app.controller

Class CardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ninja.jira.skeletonkey.app.controller.CardController
  • @CrossOrigin
@Controller
@RequestMapping(path="/api/card")
public class CardController
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the controller for class Card. Uses GET methods when retrieving data from db Uses POST methods otherwise

      • addNewCard

        @PostMapping(path="/add")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addNewCard​(@RequestParam
                                                             java.lang.String cardNumber,
                                                             @RequestParam
                                                             java.lang.String accountNumber,
                                                             @RequestParam
                                                             java.lang.Integer PIN,
                                                             @RequestParam
                                                             java.lang.String cardType,
                                                             @RequestParam
                                                             java.lang.Double spendingLimit)
        This method adds a new card to the db
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - identifies the card
        accountNumber - specifies which account the card is tied to
        PIN - authenticates the card user
        cardType - type of card (debit/credit)
        spendingLimit - limit of spending per month
        Returns:

      • getCard

        @RequestMapping(path="/get")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getCard​(@RequestParam
                                                          java.lang.String cardNumber)
        This method gets the card matching the cardNumber
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - identifies the card
        Returns:
        card object if successful, error otherwise

      • getAllCards

        @RequestMapping(path="/all")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllCards()
        This method retrieves all cards from db
        Returns:
        card objects in json, empty json if no cards in db

      • getAllCardsByAccount

        @RequestMapping(path="/account")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAllCardsByAccount​(@RequestParam
                                                                       java.lang.String accountNumber)
        This method gets all cards tied to an account
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - identifies an account
        Returns:
        card objects in json, error message otherwise

      • updateCard

        @PostMapping(path="/update")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateCard​(@RequestParam
                                                             java.lang.String cardNumber,
                                                             java.lang.String accountNumber,
                                                             java.lang.Integer PIN,
                                                             java.lang.String cardType,
                                                             java.lang.Double spendingLimit)
        This method updates the card object by the params specified in request message
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - identifies the card
        accountNumber - specifies the account tied to the card
        PIN - authenticates the card user
        cardType - type of card (debit/credit)
        spendingLimit - limit of spending per month
        Returns:
        updated card object if successful, error message otherwise

      • deleteCard

        @PostMapping(path="/delete")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteCard​(@RequestParam
                                                             java.lang.String cardNumber)
        This method deletes a card matching the cardNumber
        Parameters:
        cardNumber - identifies the card
        Returns:
        success message if card deleted, error message otherwise

      • deleteAllCards

        @PostMapping(path="/deleteall")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteAllCards()
        This method deletes all card objects in the db Does not check whether db is empty
        Returns:
        success message
